query: You have a square that has a side length of $1$ centimeter. Each minute, $2$ centimeters are added to the side length. After $10$ minutes, what will be the difference between the area of the last square and the area of the initial square in square centimeters (do not include the units in your answer)?
ground_truth: The initial square has area $1^2 = 1\text{ cm}^2$. After ten minutes, the side length of the square will be $1 + 2\cdot 10 = 21\text{ cm}$. So, the last square has area $21^2 = 441\text{ cm}^2$. So the difference in areas is $441 - 1 = \boxed{440\text{ cm}^2}$.
answers_list:
[reasoning process]

We start with a square that has a side length of \(1\) centimeter. The area of a square can be calculated using the formula \( \text{Area} = \text{side}^2 \). Therefore, the area of the initial square is:

\[
\text{Area}_{\text{initial}} = 1^2 = 1 \text{ square centimeter}
\]

Next, we note that every minute, \(2\) centimeters are added to the side length of the square. After \(10\) minutes, the total increase in the side length will be:

\[
\text{Total increase} = 2 \text{ cm/minute} \times 10 \text{ minutes} = 20 \text{ cm}
\]

Thus, the new side length of the square after \(10\) minutes will be:

\[
\text{New side length} = \text{initial side length} + \text{total increase} = 1 \text{ cm} + 20 \text{ cm} = 21 \text{ cm}
\]

We can now calculate the area of the square after \(10\) minutes:

\[
\text{Area}_{\text{new}} = 21^2 = 441 \text{ square centimeters}
\]

Next, we need to find the difference in area between the new square and the initial square:

\[
\text{Difference in area} = \text{Area}_{\text{new}} - \text{Area}_{\text{initial}} = 441 \text{ cm}^2 - 1 \text{ cm}^2 = 440 \text{ square centimeters}
\]

[Verification]

We double-check our calculations. The area of the initial square is indeed \(1\) square centimeter. The new side length after \(10\) minutes is computed correctly as \(21\) cm, leading to an area of \(441\) square centimeters. Finally, the difference calculated as \(441 - 1 = 440\) square centimeters is accurate.

[Final Answer] The answer is \\boxed{440} \n#### 440
